data.title: Winnipeg Comedy Festival
meta_keywords: About The Festival | Winnipeg Comedy Festival
data.meta_description: The Winnipeg Comedy Festival was launched in 2002 and is produced annually by the Gas Station Arts Centre. Since then, the festival has expanded to include year-round outreach programs, rural tours, workshops, and television broadcasts. #wpgcomfest
data.text:
About the Festival

The Winnipeg Comedy Festival was the brainchild of Lara Rae and CBC Radio's Tom Anniko, who worked in partnership with the Gas Station Arts Centre to bring the first comedy festival to life in 2002. Since its founding year, the festival remains the GSAC's flagship event and has come to include year-round outreach programs, rural tours, workshops, and television broadcasts that attract over 2 million viewers annually thanks to the hard work of the WCF team. The Winnipeg Comedy Festival is proud to be the highest rated comedy festival series on CBC Television.

2002

Program:

Gala Themes: Prime Ministers Show, Prairie Comedy Celebration, CBC Comedy Gala, What's So Funny About Winnipeg?, What's Up with Bedtime? and French Gala - Histoire du Manitoba 101

Highlights: Inaugural year. Ticket venues host more than 5,000 patrons and thousands more flocked to free performances throughout the city. Free performance continue today, in the festivals 7th year, and are held at the downtown malls and public library. Outreach to schools with a Comedy Festival children's story. The WCF wins a Gemini for Best Performance by a Comedian (Brian Hartt)

Comic Headliners:

Dave Broadfoot

Cathy Jones

David Steinberg

2003

Program:

Gala Themes: Sleeping with the Elephant, Prairie Crop, Becoming My Mother, Musical, Mayhem, Éclat d'humour

Highlights: The festival expands to include two rural tours – French & English – visiting four English and four French communities. Outreach to schools continues. In addition, the sold out 2003 French Gala (Drôlement Vôtres) returns to a second sold-out theatre.

Comic Headliners:

A. Whitney Brown

Brent Butt

Dean Jenkinson

Gavin Crawford

George Westerholm

Irwin Barker

Jessica Holmes

John Wing

Mark McKinney

Ron James

Program:

Turtle Island - North America's Best Aboriginal Comics,

Myths, Lies and Maple Leafs - Dispelling Canada's Cultural Myths

Modern Romance - Changing the Face of Relationships

Le Gala de l'humour

Program:

2006

Program:

Gala Themes: My Hometown International, Life's Hurdles, Relative Insanity, The Sky Is Falling, Founding Nations of Comedy, Drôlement Vôtres 4

Highlights: CBC Radio comedy series "The Debaters" premiered with host Shaun Majumder. The hit CBC Radio show features Canada's hottest comedians going toe to toe, debating topics in the news and on the minds of Canadians. The audience picks the winners based on who delivered the best logic and laughs, the best rhetoric and rant. Facts and force of argument can earn points, but in the end, jokes will likely win the match. Comedy trumps all. The Debaters airs Saturdays at 6:30pm (7:00 NT), Mondays at 8:30pm (9:00 NT) on CBC Radio One. The WFC was nominated for a Gemini in the category of Best Host of a Comedy or Variety Show (Bubbles). The number of Galas staged each year grew from two to four and then six in the festival's 5th year. The ever popular and always sold out Galas also debuted on the Comedy Network.

Poster:

Gala Themes: Tying the Knot, Raising Cane, Good Sports, Travel Show, Animals, The Medicine Show, Drôlement Vôtres 6

Highlights: To promote the festival, the Big Daddy Tazz marathon was held in the Gas Station Theatre on April Fool's Day. Tazz performed 8.5 hours of uninterrupted (that's right, no pee breaks!), original material to a full house.
